quest.name: A Day in the Neighborhood
journal: Y'shtola is staring off into the distance, lost in thought.
objectives: With the chat mode in Say, enter “allin tuta” to greet the residents of Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I wish...I wish I'd never...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am not indifferent to Thancred's troubles. Nevertheless, I will not apologize for holding him to a higher standard after all these years. He has ever been a man of considerable resolve, and that is what I will continue to expect.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though it heartens me to know that some of us remain ourselves in spite of our present circumstances.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I can but imagine how Alisaie and Alphinaud have changed since arriving here in the First.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Change is part of life. We can but hope it's change for the better.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Perhaps you should be concerned with how you have changed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: <sigh> You're right. And after my untoward remarks to Thancred, no doubt he thinks I changed for the worst. I will have to speak with him later.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I realize I am not as I was on the Source, but I cannot say I regret the decisions that allowed me to come this far.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ahem. Returning to the matter at hand─I really must begin work on deciphering this tablet. In the meantime, perhaps you should take a look about Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If there is anything you need, pray speak with Runar at the plaza.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have instructed Runar to help you with anything you should require.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Welcome, friend. Welcome! My apologies for our less-than-hospitable greeting earlier.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Tell me, what is your name? From where do you hail?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: From the Crystarium! I see. And this tablet you've brought may help us find the Lightwarden here in Rak'tika?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Well, you are welcome to stay with us for as long as you need. Come, let me show you around.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Would it be all right if I joined you?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Of course, of course. Anything for the guests of our dear Master Matoya.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thank you. She means a great deal to the Night's Blessed, doesn't she?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: If not for her, we may have all perished in the great fire.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: With our priests slain and our home in ruins, we were at the mercy of the sin eaters.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: It was she who drove them back. And with her sage guidance, we were able to rebuild.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Before long she became a central figure in our community─a great oak within whose shadow many have come to find solace.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: That is not to say there were not those hesitant to grant an outsider such authority, myself included.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Perhaps it is the smile in her eyes when she speaks of the sunless sea. I feel...whole again, now that she is with us, and I have no doubt the others feel the same.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: She is as much a part of the Night's Blessed as any of us, and we are grateful for all she does in service to the Dark.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: But you did not hear this from me, yes?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Now, you should know there are certain customs we ask guests to adhere to so long as they reside within Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: To show reverence to the Dark?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: In a word, yes. But fear not, it is not too involved.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Let us begin with something simple. Follow me.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I thought Master Matoya kept her room dark because she didn't need the light, but they're all like hers, aren't they...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Should you see any of our people come to this chamber, they have likely returned from a journey beyond the borders of Rak'tika.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: We use the water stored here to cleanse ourselves of the Light's impurity.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: A simple and perhaps peculiar custom, but it is one of our most important.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Would you two kneel for just a moment, that I might rid you of the Light's impurity?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We mustn't be rude to our hosts.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Please, this will only take a moment.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: This will only take a moment, I promise.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As Runar lightly sprays you with water, your skin begins to tingle.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: And with that, you have been cleansed of the Light's blighted touch. How do you feel?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm not sure, to be honest. Not refreshed, exactly, but I do feel different.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Has this water been treated in some way?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Only blessed by our priests. They are practiced in the arcane arts. As such, it is said their prayers imbue the water with a faint dark energy.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: A prickling sensation? No one has ever spoken of such a reaction before.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I wouldn't say it was an unpleasant sensation, but I too felt something strange.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Hmmm. The dark aspect of this water should have no discernible effect. Unless...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: By the gods! Master Matoya was right─you are sin eaters!

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: I jest, I jest. What you felt was likely no more than the chill of the water.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Perhaps now would be a good time for you to acquaint yourselves with the people of Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: For that, I must teach you a customary greeting.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Allin tuta. In the language of Ronka, it is one of several ways one might say “good evening.”

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: The world is not as safe as it once was, and this greeting lets us quickly discern friend from foe.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Is there a handshake or gesture we should know too? I would hate to offend anyone.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: You need not worry. Merely speak the words “allin tuta,” and they will know you as friends of the Blessed.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: I will await your return here. Now go. They are like to be heartened by your knowledge of our ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, enter “allin tuta” to greet the villagers of Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: No need to be shy, my friend. The Blessed are a warm and welcoming people.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: allin tuta

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The elderly woman smiles warmly.

dialogue.name: VONDIA
dialogue.text: I've no business with strangers.

dialogue.name: VONDIA
dialogue.text: Ah, a newly come traveler. Allin chi'si, and welcome to Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: VONDIA
dialogue.text: You must forgive us if we seem strangely reserved. We are a quiet and taciturn people.

dialogue.name: VONDIA
dialogue.text: Silent and serene as the sunless sea. The quiet makes it easy to discern the presence of eaters and other dangers here in the woods.

dialogue.name: VONDIA
dialogue.text: Tread lightly friend, and may the shadows keep you.

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: Away with you.

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: Allin chi'si. Welcome, friend. I take it you will remain in these woods for some time, yes?

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: Be wary of these woods, you will find poison in near everything you see. But fear not─our medicinal tea will keep you healthy. Ask and it is yours.

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: You are more than welcome to our medicines, friend. You need only ask.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: I hope your stroll about Slitherbough proved enlightening.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Everyone was so kind and gracious...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I was nervous at first, but already I'm starting to feel at home.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: There is still much I have to learn about the Night's Blessed, but their faith and strength of will is nothing short of inspiring.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I can see now how they've built such a thriving community...
